definition[0]: to get rid of something, especially a feeling such as anger, nervousness etc, by doing something that uses a lot of your energy
example[0]: Walking is excellent for working off tension.
example[1]: I need to go and work off a few of these calories.
definition[1]: to do a job for someone else because you owe them money or because they have helped you in the past
example[2]: She hasn’t worked off her debts to me yet.
